title: Facial colliculus
text: The facial colliculus is an elevated area located on the <a href="pontine%20tegmentum">pontine tegmentum</a> (dorsal pons) in the floor of the <a href="fourth%20ventricle">fourth ventricle</a>. It is formed by fibers from the <a href="facial%20motor%20nucleus">facial motor nucleus</a> of the <a href="facial%20nerve">facial nerve</a> (<a href="Cranial%20nerves">cranial nerve VII</a>) as they loop over the <a href="abducens%20nucleus">abducens nucleus</a>. Thus a lesion to the facial colliculus would result in ipsilateral facial <a href="paralysis">paralysis</a> and ipsilateral unopposed eye medial deviation.
